subject: RE: [junit] JUnit 4 and public classes
msgSnippet: ... Do you otherwise manage to have a one-to-one relationship between public and published? I would be interested to know how you do *that*... See
messageBody:
junit@yahoogroups.com wrote:

> Mostly it just offends my sense of programming aesthetics to have all
> these public classes and interfaces that aren't really part of the
> published interfaces.

Do you otherwise manage to have a one-to-one relationship between public and
published? I would be interested to know how you do *that*...

See http://www.martinfowler.com/ieeeSoftware/published.pdf for a good
article on the topic.

Cheers, Ilja
